trial_identification.studytitle: Postoperative physical activity: feasibility and effects on total body protein
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In patients having pelvic colorectal surgery is a postoperative physical activity intervention feasible and what are its effects on total body protein

interventions.interventions: From day 2 after surgery patients will undergo supervised physical activity in a ward setting. This will entail 1)walking on a treadmill to intensity determined by patient and measured by Borg scale 2) bench stepping to 15 cm or 25 cm bench height. There are 2-3 activity sessions per day with increasing duration (9-18 mins) of treadmill sessions, no. of bench steps and bench step height over the 6 days.
interventions.comparator: Current standard care on surgical wards; sitting out of bed and ad-lib mobilisation. Recorded by physical activity monitors.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Enforced mobilisation - minutes and distances walked/day + bench steps/day Recorded by ActiReader physical activity monitor
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Both daily and cumulative at six days

primaryOutcome.outcome: Passive mobilisation Recorded by ActiReader physical activity monitor
primaryOutcome.timepoint: Both daily and cumulative at six days

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Total body protein/muscle mass/lean body mass as measured by in vivo neutron activation analysis, whole body pottasium counting and DEXA.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Pelvic colorectal surgery (elective) - low anterior resection, abdominoperineal resection, proctectomy/pouch reconstruction
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Incurable metastatic disease Medical comorbidity and physical disability that precludes exercise BMI>40 WHO performance score > 3 Complications during immediate postoperative course (Clavien grade 3b or higher)

trial_design.concealment: Potential participants will be approached at the time of their preoperative outpatient clinic. They will be given a Particiant Information Sheet and contacted a few days later to discuss the study further and decide whether they wish to be enrolled. Participants are randomised (allocation concealment by off-site randomisation by Macro Randomisation Module (MacroTM EDM, InferMed, London, UK) over the internet on day of surgery
